headline: Anthropic plans an IPO as early as 2026, FT reports
summary: Anthropic, the artificial intelligence startup backed by Alphabet's Google and Amazon.com, has hired the law firm Wilson Sonsini to prepare for an initial ​public offering that could take place as early as 2026, the Financial Times ‌reported on Tuesday.  An IPO would give the company, which operates the AI chatbot Claude, a more efficient way to ‌raise capital and provide leverage for bigger acquisitions through public stock.  The company ⁠has previously turned to Wilson Sonsini ‌for a range of corporate matters.

content.title: Anthropic plans an IPO as early as 2026, FT reports
content.summary: Anthropic, the artificial intelligence startup backed by Alphabet's Google and Amazon.com, has hired the law firm Wilson Sonsini to prepare for an initial ​public offering that could take place as early as 2026, the Financial Times ‌reported on Tuesday.  An IPO would give the company, which operates the AI chatbot Claude, a more efficient way to ‌raise capital and provide leverage for bigger acquisitions through public stock.  The company ⁠has previously turned to Wilson Sonsini ‌for a range of corporate matters.

headline: Asian shares are mixed as steady bond yields, rebound for bitcoin push US stocks higher
summary: Asian shares were mixed Wednesday after stocks on Wall Street held steadier as both bond yields and bitcoin stabilized.  U.S. futures rose and oil prices edged higher.  Tokyo's Nikkei 225 jumped 1.6% to 50,063.65 on big gains for technology shares like Tokyo Electron, which jumped 5.6%.

content.title: Asian shares are mixed as steady bond yields, rebound for bitcoin push US stocks higher
content.summary: Asian shares were mixed Wednesday after stocks on Wall Street held steadier as both bond yields and bitcoin stabilized.  U.S. futures rose and oil prices edged higher.  Tokyo's Nikkei 225 jumped 1.6% to 50,063.65 on big gains for technology shares like Tokyo Electron, which jumped 5.6%.

thumbnail.caption: A person on a bicycle waits in front of an electronic stock board showing Japan's Nikkei index at a securities firm Monday, Dec. 1, 2025, in Tokyo. (AP Photo/Eugene Hoshiko)

headline: Bitcoin's warning for Nvidia, AI stocks, and gold
summary: You can catch Trader Talk on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, YouTube, or wherever you get your podcasts. Bitcoin's (BTC-USD) sharp drop into bear-market territory might be the market’s first real warning flare about crowded AI trades and stretched tech valuations. On this episode of Trader Talk, veteran futures and options trader Jim Iuorio joins Kenny Polcari to unpack what bitcoin’s sell-off says about risk appetite, Nvidia’s (NVDA) 15% slide, and whether we’re in the early innings of an AI bubble. They dig into why gold (GC=F) is ripping higher on central bank buying and US fiscal worries, debate 50-year mortgages and tariff “dividends,” and game out the Fed’s next move on rates heading into 2026. It’s a fast and practical roadmap for traders navigating crypto volatility, AI euphoria, and the new gold bull market. Watch more episodes of Trader Talk here. Trader Talk with Kenny Polcari on Yahoo Finance delivers expert analysis and actionable insights, empowering you to navigate market volatility and secure your financial future. This post was written by Langston Sessoms.

headline: Salesforce’s Stock Is Historically Cheap as AI Risk Takes a Toll
summary: The maker of customer relationship management software reports earnings after the bell, and has recently pointed to better times ahead, forecasting double-digit revenue growth in the coming years.  “We need a change in sentiment for investors to take a look, and that will be driven by stability and an improvement in topline growth,” said Hilary Frisch, senior research analyst at ClearBridge Investments.  Salesforce’s stock price has been hammered by pessimism all year, plunging 30% in 2025 to make the company the second-worst performer in the Dow Jones Industrial Average and putting it among the 25 worst in the S&P 500 Index.

content.title: Salesforce’s Stock Is Historically Cheap as AI Risk Takes a Toll
content.summary: The maker of customer relationship management software reports earnings after the bell, and has recently pointed to better times ahead, forecasting double-digit revenue growth in the coming years.  “We need a change in sentiment for investors to take a look, and that will be driven by stability and an improvement in topline growth,” said Hilary Frisch, senior research analyst at ClearBridge Investments.  Salesforce’s stock price has been hammered by pessimism all year, plunging 30% in 2025 to make the company the second-worst performer in the Dow Jones Industrial Average and putting it among the 25 worst in the S&P 500 Index.

headline: Nvidia’s Fat Margins Are Google and AMD’s Opportunity
summary: The AI revolution has created a unique and high-quality problem for  Nvidia  : The chip maker makes too much money.  Nvidia has fallen under scrutiny over the past month as investors have come to worry about the sustainability of blowout artificial-intelligence spending.  Nvidia’s stock price has picked up some ground this week, but the shares are still down 12% since the company peaked at a $5 trillion market cap in late October.

content.title: Nvidia’s Fat Margins Are Google and AMD’s Opportunity
content.summary: The AI revolution has created a unique and high-quality problem for  Nvidia  : The chip maker makes too much money.  Nvidia has fallen under scrutiny over the past month as investors have come to worry about the sustainability of blowout artificial-intelligence spending.  Nvidia’s stock price has picked up some ground this week, but the shares are still down 12% since the company peaked at a $5 trillion market cap in late October.

headline: ADP Jobs Report Shows Surprise Drop In Private Payrolls; S&P 500 Futures Rise
summary: Private-sector employers unexpectedly payrolls in November amid the government shutdown, ADP reported on Wednesday.  After the ADP report, S&P 500 futures slightly extended slim gains, with Nvidia rising back toward a buy point.  The ADP jobs report has taken on greater significance amid the disruption of official government data due to the shutdown.

content.title: ADP Jobs Report Shows Surprise Drop In Private Payrolls; S&P 500 Futures Rise

After the ADP report, S&P 500 futures slightly extended slim gains, with Nvidia rising back toward a buy point.  The ADP jobs report has taken on greater significance amid the disruption of official government data due to the shutdown.

headline: AI Weekly: Nvidia's OpenAI deal wait and mega chip plants
summary:
STORY: The wait goes on for Nvidia's huge OpenAI deal, while a mega chip plant could come to Japan....

:: AI Weekly

This is AI Weekly. 

Nvidia’s CFO said the chipmaker’s deal to invest $100 billion in ChatGPT parent OpenAI isn't yet finalized. 

The partnership would tie two of the top heavyweights in the AI race…

But it's also at the center of rising investor concerns around so-called circular deals in the AI ecosystem - as Nvidia invests heavily in firms which are also major customers.

The deal proposal involves deploying at least 10 gigawatts of systems for OpenAI, enough to power over 8 million U.S. homes.

Anthropic, the AI startup backed by Google and Amazon, is preparing for an IPO as early as next year.

That was according to a Financial Times report.

It added the startup’s negotiating a private funding round that could give it a valuation exceeding $300 billion.

But an Anthropic spokesperson didn't confirm to Reuters when or even if it will go public.

Micron Technology will invest $9.6 billion in Japan to build an AI memory chip plant. 

That was the word from Japan's Nikkei, citing people familiar with the matter. 

The plant is reportedly due to go up in Hiroshima in western Japan and produce advanced high-bandwidth memory chips.

The report said the U.S. chipmaker aims to start construction in May next year and begin shipments of the chips around 2028. 

Top Chinese firms are training their AI models abroad, according to the Financial Times.

That’s to access Nvidia's chips and avoid U.S. measures aimed at curbing their progress in advanced technology.

Citing sources, the FT said Alibaba and ByteDance are among those training their newest large language models in Southeast Asian data centers. 

Reuters could not immediately verify the report.

And Taiwan’s tech-heavy economy is expected to grow at its fastest pace in 15 years...

As it rides the wave of demand for AI technology

That’s according to the country's statistics office.

It said GDP is expected to expand more than 7.3% this year - a jump from the near 4.5% pace predicted in August. 

However, it added U.S. tariffs are likely to cloud next year’s outlook.

content.title: AI Weekly: Nvidia's OpenAI deal wait and mega chip plants

headline: The AI Trade Has Powered Wall Street Through Bitcoin’s Wobble. It Sets Up a December Rally.
summary: If  Bitcoin  late autumn slump was meant to drive a stake into the heart of the animal spirits that have powered risky assets higher for much of the past three years, the stock market appears largely unscathed and more than willing to roll the dice into the final weeks of December.  Bitcoin prices, which are inexorably tied to investor sentiment, have rebounded firmly over the past two days, taking the world’s largest cryptocurrency back above $93,000 and stoking risk appetite in markets around the world.

content.title: The AI Trade Has Powered Wall Street Through Bitcoin’s Wobble. It Sets Up a December Rally.
content.summary: If  Bitcoin  late autumn slump was meant to drive a stake into the heart of the animal spirits that have powered risky assets higher for much of the past three years, the stock market appears largely unscathed and more than willing to roll the dice into the final weeks of December.  Bitcoin prices, which are inexorably tied to investor sentiment, have rebounded firmly over the past two days, taking the world’s largest cryptocurrency back above $93,000 and stoking risk appetite in markets around the world.

headline: Trump Closes in on Fed Chair Pick. It’s a Boost for Cryptos and These Stocks.
summary: Amazon announces AI chips, Marvell’s data center business takes off, Bitcoin recoups lost ground, and more news to start your day.
